title: Getting Started
text: can install development version fleetbr GitHub :

title: Getting Started
text: Afterwards, package can loaded along dplyr, ggplot2 lubridate packages filtering plotting subset data: example, time series data state São Paulo displayed:
code: library(fleetbr) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(lubridate) fleetbr |>    filter(uf == "SP") |>    mutate(     dates = ym(paste0(ano,"-",mes))   ) |>    ggplot(aes(dates,frota, color = modal)) +      geom_line(linewidth = 1)

title: Authors and Citation
text: João Pedro Melani Saraiva. Author, maintainer. Pedro Augusto Borges Santos. Author. ONSV - National Road Safety Observatory. Copyright holder, funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Saraiva JPM, Santos PAB (2024). fleetbr: Brazilian Vehicle Fleet Dataset. R package version 0.1.2, https://github.com/jotasaraiva/fleetbr, https://jotasaraiva.github.io/fleetbr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {fleetbr: Brazilian Vehicle Fleet Dataset},   author = {João Pedro Melani Saraiva and Pedro Augusto Borges Santos},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.2, https://github.com/jotasaraiva/fleetbr},   url = {https://jotasaraiva.github.io/fleetbr/}, }

title: Brazilian Ministry of Transport Road Fleet data — fleetbr
Brazilian Ministry of Transport Road Fleet data — fleetbr
text: tibble data frame 78,408 5 columns: uf Federative Unit - Brazilian States Acronyms mes, ano Month Year modal Mode transport observation frota Fleet size
